meanings.definition: Intense and passionate feeling or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: Her eyes sparkled with fervor as she talked about her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered with fervor as the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: His fervor for pizza was unmatched, he could eat it every day.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted with such fervor that the colors seemed to leap off the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The fervor in her voice made everyone believe in her cause.

meanings.sent1: The fervor of the sun made the pavement too hot to walk on barefoot.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith worked near the furnace, feeling the fervor of the flames.
meanings.sent3: The fervor of the oven turned the cookies into crispy delights.
meanings.sent4: The fervor of the bonfire warmed everyone on the chilly night.
meanings.sent5: The fervor of the summer sun made the ice cream melt quickly.
